data.title: Southern Lights
data.meta_description: Southern Lights definition: 1. coloured lights that form a pattern and are sometimes seen in the night sky in the most southern…. Learn more.
data.text:
noun [ plural ]

(also southern lights) uk

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˌsʌð.ən ˈlaɪts/ us

Your browser doesn't support HTML5 audio

/ˌsʌð.ɚn ˈlaɪts/

the Southern Lights

coloured lights that form a pattern and are sometimes seen in the night sky in the most southern parts of the world:

"Oh man," he cried as he witnessed a shimmering display of the Southern Lights.

The Auroras are the northern lights (aurora borealis) in the northern hemisphere and the southern lights (aurora australis) in the southern hemisphere.

Synonym

Compare

More examplesFewer examples

The southern lights are a luminous phenomena of assorted shapes and colours taking place 35-600 miles above the earth.

In the far north the lights are the stuff of legend and because this planet's magnetic field is just as energetic over the South Pole, down there they are the southern lights, the aurora australis.

(Definition of Southern Lights from the Cambridge Advanced Learner's Dictionary & Thesaurus © Cambridge University Press)
